title: Lady Gaga, Jennifer Lawrence and Brie Larson in Golden Globes behind the scenes portraits
title_page: Lady Gaga, Jennifer Lawrence and Brie Larson in Golden Globes behind the scenes portraits | Daily Mail Online
text:
Winners and presenters from Sunday night's Golden Globes have been beautifully captured in a set of stunning photographic portraits taken behind the scenes of the star-studded ceremony.
The likes of Lady Gaga, Jennifer Lawrence and Brie Larson were snapped by revered Dutch photography duo Inez van Lamsweerde and Vinoodh Matadin as they left the stage.
Musician-turned-actress Gaga, 29, called her win in the Best Performance By An Actress In A Limited Series Or Motion Picture Made For Television category for her role as The Countess Elizabeth in American Horror Story 'one of the greatest moment of my life'.

Eyes on the prize: Winners and presenters from Sunday night's Golden Globes have been beautifully captured in a set of stunning photographic portraits taken behind the scenes of the star-studded ceremony
And she looked every inch the film icon in her portrait, as she clutched her award while gazing down at the camera lens.
The star resembled a 50s siren, with her blonde Marilyn Monroe-style blonde locks and off the shoulder black gown the very essence of glamour.
Jennifer Lawrence, 25, cut a powerful figure in her portrait which was taken after she received the Best Actress In A Motion Picture - Musical Or Comedy gong for 'Joy'.
See full Golden Globes coverage on the portraits taken of winners with their awards
Award-winner: Jennifer Lawrence, 25, cut a powerful figure in her portrait which was taken after she received the Best Actress In A Motion Picture - Musical Or Comedy gong for 'Joy'
Striking: Brie Larson, 26, showcased her feminine beauty as she struck a sexy pose in a shimmering sequinned dress
Put 'em up: Sylvester Stallone won Best Performance By An Actor In A Supporting Role - Motion Picture for 'Creed'
The Hunger Games star wore her blonde locks slicked back into a faux crop on the night which saw her collect her fourth Globe.
Brie Larson, 26, showcased her feminine beauty as she struck a sexy pose in a shimmering sequinned dress.
The actress claimed the award for Best Performance By An Actress In A Motion Picture - Drama for her role in 'Room'.
Double team: Alejandro Inarritu and Leonardo DiCaprio claimed Best Director - Motion Picture and Best Performance By An Actor In A Motion Picture - Drama, respectively, for 'The Revenant'
Dramatic: Taraji P. Henson took home Best Performance By An Actress In A Television Series - Drama for 'Empire'
No reason to be mad: Jon Hamm claimed Best Performance By An Actor In A Television Series - Drama for 'Mad Men'
Music buddies: Sam Smith and Jimmy Napes' 'Writing's On The Wall' from Bond film 'Spectre' won Best Original Song - Motion Picture
Tilting her head back for the shot, she reached up and interlocked her fingers while mainting seductive eye contact with the camera.
Other stars pictured included Mark Wahlberg with Will Ferrell, Leonardo DiCaprio with director Alejandro Inarritu, Sam Smith, Taraji P. Henson, Matt Damon and Sylvester Stallone.
Last year, Ellen von Unwerth was charged with capturing the winners in a series of glittery backstage portraits.
Comedy gold: Mark Wahlberg and Will Ferrell's bromance was captured in black and white
English beauty: Kate Winslet was stunned by her Best Performance By An Actress In A Motion Picture win for 'Steve Jobs'
Handsome: Christian Slater took home the Best Performance By An Actor In A Supporting Role In A Series, Limited Series Or Motion Picture Made For Television gong for Mr. Robot
Fashion photographers Inez and Vinoodh have worked together since 1986.
They have worked on campaigns for Chanel, Roberto Cavalli, Donna Karan, DKNY, Stella McCartney, Brioni, Moschino, been featured in a plethora of fashion publications and even directed Lady Gaga's 2013 Applause music video.
The duo told Instagram: 'We really like people, and the idea of finding the most iconic, the most heroic, the most timeless, the most essential image of someone.'
Superstar: Matt Damon put on a poker face, alongside Amy Adams after winning Best Performance By An Actor In A Motion Picture - Musical Or Comedy for 'The Martian'
Simple, yet effective: Andy Samberg played it straight with a subtle smile in his portrait
